results.title: No longer alone
results.creator_credit: Frank Cadman, Terry Ashwood and Associated British-Pathe
results.brief_description: Tuition available in Britain for blind children who have additional defects. Several homes, caring for different age groups, are run on the “family” system, seven to a family. Affection is given, confidence built up and each child is taught to fend for themselves to the best of their ability. Other subjects, besides classwork, are handwork, nature study, swimming, and independent outings to nearby towns.

results.title: No lies
results.creator_credit: Michael W. Block and Phoenix Films
results.brief_description: A male filmmaker (played by an actor) interviews a female friend who confides to him that she has been raped. She relates problems she has experienced with the police, her doctor, her friends and her own reactions. This short fictional film masquerades as a documentary and raises questions about the relationship between filmmaker and subject as the conversation shades into interview, interrogation and forced confession.

results.title: No laws today
results.creator_credit: Dave Gibson and Gibson Film Productions
results.brief_description: The day has been declared ‘a lawless day’. The film follows a couple through this theoretical day as they leave home to do some quiet shopping and participate in a game of rugby football. As they move through the chaos which the experiment brings, the young viewer is shown the advantages of laws and rules for traffic, consumer affairs and sport. Cast includes: Ross Jolly, Ginette McDonald, John Banas, Keith Aberdeen.

results.title: No labels for Annie
results.creator_credit: Stephen Skok and Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group
results.brief_description: A portrait of Annette Duras, a young woman whose life has become enriched and meaningful since obtaining a job in “open employment”. The program highlights the need for us to resist categorising others with destructive labels and illustrates the positive effect on people when labels are discarded.

results.title: No help wanted
results.creator_credit: Orlando Lippert and Wilding Picture Productions
results.brief_description: This film is a study of the rehabilitation of disabled American servicemen of both world wars, showing not only their training during hospitalisation, but their mastery of many jobs in industry. The film makes it clear that a handicapped veteran is not a business liability, but on the contrary is an efficient and reliable worker. The insurance companies’ attitude is an indication of the esteem in which the disabled veteran worker is held.

results.title: No going back
results.creator_credit: Scott Hicks, Terry Jennings, South Australian Film Corporation and Chrysalis Films
results.brief_description: This film sensitively explores the extreme problems of social adjustment experienced by people newly released from prison. After several years of confinement within an ordered monochrome prison life, the outside world is a noisy busy place. Housing, money, wives, defactos, children, a job - all have to be sorted out within a short time if the ex-prisoner is not going to fall back on old ways, old friends, and the same situations which led to prison in the first place. Cast includes Chris Haywood, Richard Moir, Jennifer Scott-Roberts, Geraldine Smedley and Ellen Freeman.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Scott Hicks, Terry Jennings, South Australian Film Corporation and Chrysalis Films

results.title: No frontiers for kilowatts
results.brief_description: An essential step for European cooperation has been reached in the field of energy supply. The continually changing requirements of electricity at different times of day, different seasons and weather conditions, is being supplied by power plants. With voltages up to 380,000 volts high tension wires thousands of miles long cross the frontier and provide power to all European countries.
